name: BBCWorld
text:
More than 10 million cases of coronavirus have been recorded around the world

500,000+ people have died with the virus

The head of the World Health Organization says weâ€™re in a dangerous new phase in the crisis
 
[Thread]

name: BBCWorld
text:
Many countries in western Europe and Asia appear to have the virus under some degree of control

But, other regions of the world are now seeing the disease spread at an accelerating rate

https://t.co/GD5lSDFpbg https://t.co/ztlBK6v9Hg

name: BBCWorld
text:
Brazil, India, Mexico, the US and South Africa have seen significant increases in coronavirus cases

Coronavirus has become "a disease of poor people", according to David Nabarro, the WHO's special envoy for Covid-19

https://t.co/GD5lSDFpbg https://t.co/KZf60HhTeI

name: BBCWorld
text:
The US, already recording the most infections and most deaths from coronavirus anywhere in the world, is seeing further startling increases

The number of positive tests recorded in the past few days reached a daily record total of 40,000

https://t.co/GD5lSDFpbg https://t.co/2B6w4FBjcD

name: BBCWorld
text:
South Korea, Australia, New Zealand and Vietnam appear to have more control of the spread of the virus

New Zealand recorded a 24-day period with no new cases, while Vietnam claims to have had no deaths from Covid-19 at all

https://t.co/GD5lSDFpbg https://t.co/IGTAPq5Lpd
